rules.6x6: Place a digit from 1 to 6 into each empty cell in the grid so that each digit appears exactly once in each row, column and 2x3 outlined box. The number in each circle (or oval), reading left-to-right or top-to-bottom, is a multiple or a divisor of the other number it is connected to. The two numbers can be the same.
rules.9x9: Place a digit from 1 to 9 into each empty cell in the grid so that each digit appears exactly once in each row, column and 3x3 outlined box. The number in each circle (or oval), reading left-to-right or top-to-bottom, is a multiple or a divisor of the other number it is connected to. The two numbers can be the same.
